name: methyl 3-chloro-4-methoxybenzoate
Reason: The basic unit for comparison could be benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The chlorine atom in the para position increases the melting point due to stronger London dispersion forces, typically by +60 °C. The methoxy group (CH3O-) adds polarity and can form hydrogen bonds, which can increase the melting point by approximately +20 °C. The presence of two functional groups, chlorine and methoxy, in the para position relative to each other may slightly reduce symmetry and possibly decrease the overall effect on melting point when compared to a more symmetrically substituted molecule.
